intro: Cicer songaricum var. spinosum, commonly known as the spiny chickpea, is a variant of the chickpea species native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, spiny pods and small, round seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. It is an annual legume that produces a distinctive, prickly appearance due to its thorny stems and pods. This variety is often cultivated for its hardy nature and potential use in traditional agriculture.
